text: Alfred 'Alf' John Matthews (1938-1997), was a male boxer who competed for England. ==Boxing career== He represented England in the 75 kg middleweight division at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Perth, Western Australia. He was a member of the Litherland Amateur Boxing Club and was twice ABA middleweight champion in 1962 and 1963. He made his professional debut on 11 June 1963 and fought in 13 fights until 1965. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:1997 deaths Category:English male boxers Category:Boxers at the 1962 British Empire and Commonwealth Games Category:Middleweight boxers
title: Alf Matthews (boxer)
